skill.name: skills-creator
skill.description: Creates and maintains Agent Skills with effective triggers and progressive disclosure. Use when user requests to create a skill, generate a SKILL.md, build custom capabilities, or mentions "create skill", "new skill", or "skill configuration".
skill.summary: Creates and maintains Agent Skills following Claude Code best practices for discoverability and progressive disclosure.
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: All 429 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is a documentation-driven meta-skill that reads reference files and creates SKILL.md files. The static analyzer incorrectly flagged code examples within markdown documentation as security issues. No actual shell commands, cryptographic operations, or system reconnaissance occur at runtime.

low_findings.title: Static Pattern Detection in Documentation
low_findings.description: The static analyzer detected patterns in markdown documentation that resemble shell commands, cryptographic references, and system operations. These are code examples within documentation, not actual executable code. The skill does not run shell commands or perform cryptographic operations at runtime.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Pattern matching in markdown code blocks is legitimate documentation, not executable code. The skill only reads documentation and creates new files using Write tool.

content.value_statement: Creating Agent Skills manually requires understanding complex formatting rules and best practices. This skill automates skill creation by reading reference documentation, validating inputs, and generating properly-structured SKILL.md files following Claude Code conventions.
actual_capabilities: Reads best practices documentation to understand current skill authoring guidelines
Validates skill names for length, character set, and reserved word restrictions
Generates SKILL.md files with proper YAML frontmatter and markdown structure
Organizes skill resources in appropriate folder structures
limitations: Does not execute user commands or modify system files outside the skill creation workflow
Does not create or run scripts within generated skills
Does not install dependencies or configure development environments
Does not integrate with external APIs or network services

use_cases.title: New Skill Development
use_cases.description: A developer wants to create a new Agent Skill for PDF processing. They ask the skill to create a skill, and it generates a properly formatted SKILL.md with workflow steps, rules, and acceptance criteria.
use_cases.target_user: Developers extending Claude Code capabilities for specific domains

use_cases.title: Team Skill Standardization
use_cases.description: A team lead wants all team skills to follow consistent naming conventions and documentation patterns. The skill ensures new skills match existing team standards.
use_cases.target_user: Team leads establishing shared skill libraries

use_cases.title: Plugin Skill Creation
use_cases.description: A plugin developer needs to bundle multiple related skills with consistent structure. The skill creates uniform SKILL.md files across the skill collection.
use_cases.target_user: Plugin authors creating skill packages for distribution

prompt_templates.title: Basic Skill Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Agent Skill called [skill-name] that [what it does]. Use when [when to use it].

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Skill with Rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill called [skill-name] for [purpose]. Include workflow steps: 1) [step 1], 2) [step 2], 3) [step 3]. Add rules: [rule 1], [rule 2]. Use when [triggers].
prompt_templates.scenario: Complex skill requiring specific operational procedures

prompt_templates.title: Restricted Tools Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a read-only skill called [skill-name] for [purpose]. Allowed tools: Read, Grep, Glob. Use when [trigger conditions].
prompt_templates.scenario: Skill requiring limited tool access for security

prompt_templates.title: Multi-File Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill called [skill-name] with supporting files: [reference file] for [purpose], [scripts folder] for [purpose]. Include instructions for loading additional files.
prompt_templates.scenario: Complex skill requiring reference documentation and utility scripts

output_examples.input: Create a skill called pdf-processor that extracts text from PDF files.
output: - Description: Extracts text from PDF files. Use when working with PDF documents.
- Add any specific workflow instructions to SKILL.md
- Create supporting files in .claude/skills/pdf-processor/ if needed

output_examples.input: Create a skill called git-commits that generates commit messages from staged changes.
output: - Description: Generates descriptive commit messages by analyzing staged git changes. Use when writing commit messages or reviewing staged changes.
Note: This skill will use git commands. Ensure git is available in your environment.

best_practices: Use specific trigger phrases in descriptions to help Claude discover the skill when relevant
Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines and reference additional files for detailed documentation
Match freedom level to task fragility: high freedom for flexible tasks, low freedom for precise sequences
anti_patterns: Vague descriptions like "processes data" or "helps with files" that prevent skill discovery
Including information Claude already knows or can infer
Creating overly broad skills that should be split into focused, single-purpose skills

faq.question: Where should I store the skills I create?
faq.answer: Personal skills go in ~/.claude/skills/. Project skills go in .claude/skills/ within your project directory. Project skills are shared via git.

faq.question: What characters are allowed in skill names?
faq.answer: Skill names must use only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. Maximum length is 64 characters. Reserved words like 'anthropic' and 'claude' cannot be used.

faq.question: How does Claude discover my skills?
faq.answer: Claude reads skill names and descriptions at startup. It selects relevant skills based on your request matching the description. Specific trigger phrases improve discovery.

faq.question: Can I restrict which tools a skill can use?
faq.answer: Yes. Add the allowed-tools field to the YAML frontmatter listing specific tools. Claude will only use those tools when this skill is active.

faq.question: How do I test if my skill works correctly?
faq.answer: Ask a question that matches your skill description. Claude will autonomously activate the skill. Use specific trigger terms from your description.

faq.question: What should I include in the skill description?
faq.answer: Describe what the skill does and when to use it. Include specific keywords users might mention. Write in third person voice without 'I' or 'you'.
